title.rendered: Canada Student and Spouse Visa: Apply Together or Separately?

  • Can I Apply For a Canada Study Permit and Spouse Visa together?
  • Why do people Avoid Applying for Canada Study Spouse Visa together?
  • Canada Student Spouse Visa Requirements
  • Step-By-Step Application Process for Canada Study Spouse Visa
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text]Thousands of international students pursue higher education at Canada’s prestigious Colleges and Universities each year. Many of these students are married and have families they do not want to part from.

If you find yourself in a similar situation, you might ask, “Can my spouse work in Canada while I study?” The answer is Yes. Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) offers each international student’s spouse the option of applying for a spousal work permit.

Couples who intend to come to Canada using this arrangement often think they must apply separately for their student visa and spousal open work permit. They believe this because of incorrect advice given to them by immigration consultants.

It is generally better for couples to apply for a student visa and spousal work permit together. This guide will examine why applying for Canadian student and spouse visas together is a better option and how to pursue it.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Can I Apply For a Canada Study Permit and Spouse Visa together?

You can apply for an official Canada study permit and spouse visa at the same time. IRCC encourages applications for Canada Student Visa with spouse and child due to their faster processing times.

The alternative arrangement, where you would apply for each separately, takes much longer. For example, applying for a student visa takes around 2 to 3 months. If your spouse applies for their work permit after you have received your student visa, they will need to wait several months before being able to join you in Canada.

You can bypass this process and apply for a Canada study visa with your spouse quickly with the help of experienced Regulated Canadian Immigration Consultants, such as Colossus Migration.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” top_padding=”5%” bottom_padding=”5%” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][image_with_animation image_url=”12981″ animation=”None” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default”][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”1px” column_border_color=”#707070″ column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

Apply for Canada Study Visa with Spouse

[/vc_column_text][nectar_btn size=”large” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”default_arrow” text=”Book a consultation” url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/book-consultation/business-immigration/” margin_top=”20px”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_custom_heading text=”Why Do People Avoid Applying for a Canada Study Spouse Visa Together?” use_theme_fonts=”yes” el_id=”avoid”][vc_column_text]Misformation is why people avoid applying for a Canada student visa spousal work permit together. There is a lot of incorrect information about this topic on the internet. Many websites and forums urge people to apply for student visas and work permits separately to avoid rejection. However, such claims are untrue.

Inexperienced immigration consultants also urge people to apply for student visas and work permits separately. This is because they aren’t aware that IRCC offers a route for international students and their spouses to apply together.[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”Canada Student Spouse Visa Requirements” use_theme_fonts=”yes” el_id=”eligibility”][vc_column_text]If you are interested in applying for your student visa and spouse work permit together, you and your spouse must meet the following Canada study spouse visa requirements:

Minimum Marriage Length

You and your spouse must be married for a minimum of one year before applying for a student visa and spousal work permit together. This is one of the most important Canadian student spouse visa requirements that was implemented to help reduce the chances of people using fraudulent marriages to get into Canada.

Marriage Documents

You and your partner will need to provide adequate documents related to your marriage. This includes basic items such as your marriage certificate. However, you will also need to include an additional personal proof, such as photographs of your marriage ceremony.

Proof of An Ongoing Relationship

IRCC also requires applicants to demonstrate they are in an ongoing relationship. So even if you are married, you will need to show additional evidence of your relationship. This includes proof you and your spouse are living together in the same house.

You can offer this proof in the form of driver’s licenses, identification documents, and insurance policies that all have the same address listed on them.

Learn more: Prove Genuineness of Relationship in Spouse Visa

Proof of Funds

You must demonstrate that you have enough funds to support yourself and your spouse while in Canada. The good news is that this funds requirement isn’t very high since the assumption is that your spouse will be working in Canada and earning for you and your children. For this reason, you must show that you have enough funds to cover your study program when you submit your application.

Information on Your Children

IRCC also requires you to provide the birth certificate and other identification documents for any children coming to Canada with you and your spouse.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” top_padding=”5%” bottom_padding=”5%” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][image_with_animation image_url=”12982″ animation=”None” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default”][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”1px” column_border_color=”#707070″ column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

Get Help With Canada Student Spouse Visa

[/vc_column_text][nectar_btn size=”large” open_new_tab=”true” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”default_arrow” text=”Enquire Now” url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/book-consultation/” margin_top=”20px”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_custom_heading text=”Step-By-Step Application Process for Canada Study Spouse Visa” use_theme_fonts=”yes” el_id=”application-process”][vc_column_text]If you and your spouse intend to pursue a student visa and spousal work permit simultaneously, you will need to follow the application process described below:

Step 1: Perform Research and Planning

The first step is to perform adequate research and planning. This includes understanding what education you want to pursue and applying to Canadian Colleges and Universities accordingly. Then you must choose the correct student stream for your student visa application.

You can reach out to an experienced professional for help with this. You should then find out what education, language, and financial documents you will need to submit with your application.

Step 2: Take Language Tests

The prospective student and their spouse must take language tests demonstrating their language proficiency. Once you and your spouse have received your results, you can include them with your application.

Step 3: Submit the Application

Next, you must fill out and submit your applications for the student visa and spousal work permit. Be sure to include all the documents requested for each application.

Step 4: Wait for the Decision and Come to Canada

If your student visa application has been approved, you will get your student visa and be allowed to go to Canada. If your spouse is approved, they will receive a notification around two weeks after your study visa is approved. They can then join you in Canada once they receive their work permit.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” top_padding=”5%” bottom_padding=”5%” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][image_with_animation image_url=”12983″ animation=”None” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default”][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”1px” column_border_color=”#707070″ column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

Apply for Canada Student Spouse Visa Together

[/vc_column_text][nectar_btn size=”large” open_new_tab=”true” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”none” text=”Book Consultation” url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/book-consultation/” margin_top=”20px”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_custom_heading text=”Need help?” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]As you can see, you can apply for your student visa and your spouse’s work permit together. Few immigration consultants are familiar with the application process, so it is best to seek help from the knowledgeable Regulated Canadian Immigration Consultants at Colossus Migration. We have helped many applicants come to Canada with their spouses and children using this program. Please contact Colossus Migration today to get started with this Canada student spouse visa application.

excerpt.rendered: How to Apply for Spouse Visa & Study Visa Together? Here’s a simple step-by-step guide to Canada Student Spouse Visa requirements and the application process.
